data.title: Orchestras
data.text:
Listen In

Oboe Concerto in C Major K314, I. Allegro aperto by W.A. Mozart | Symphony No. 1 in C minor, Op. 68, I. Un poco sostenuto - Allegro by Johannes Brahms | Symphony No. 8 in G Major, IV. Allegro by Antonin Dvorak

Audition Information

Auditions for this academic-year ensemble are held in June at our annual Ensemble Placement Day. At the audition, students are expected to perform scales, a solo or etudes demonstrating current skill level, and sight-read a piece (provided at the audition).

Auditions for our large ensemble program are accepted on a rolling basis during the academic year. All new students must audition to be placed in the proper ensemble. To learn more about Ensemble Placement Day in June and sign up, visit the link here.

Rehearsals

CYS will meet on Sundays from 1:30-3:30 p.m. in Bliss Music Room

Opus '89

In 1989, the late David Einfeldt founded the Hartt Suzuki Orchestras, with Opus â€˜89 being the premier ensemble. Today, this string orchestra is open, by audition, to very advanced string players, regardless of their training method. This orchestra performs challenging String Orchestra literature, frequently collaborates with composers on new works, and occasionally performs symphonic works. Recent performance tours include Montreal/Quebec City, and NYC (including an Opus performance at Carnegie Hall.). Conducted by Emmett Drake.

Click here to learn more about the additional Suzuki Orchestras.

Audition Information

Auditions for this academic-year ensemble are held in June at our annual Ensemble Placement Day. At the audition, students are expected to perform scales, a solo or etudes demonstrating current skill level, and sight-read a piece (provided at the audition).

Auditions for our large ensemble program are accepted on a rolling basis during the academic year. All new students must audition to be placed in the proper ensemble. To learn more about Ensemble Placement Day in June and sign up, visit the link here.

Rehearsals

Opus '89 will meet on Saturdays from 12:30-2:30 p.m. in Bliss Music Room
